Info Source: Included in a dataset downloaded at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Company is plan administrator. Penalty amount reported in range of $50,001 to $100,000.

Description: Oracle Corp. and Oracle America Inc. agreed to pay $199.5 million plus interest for failing to meet their contractual obligations to the General Services Administration. Oracle had been accused of failing to meet its contractual obligations to provide GSA with current, accurate and complete information about its commercial sales practices, including discounts offered to other customers, and that Oracle knowingly made false statements to GSA about its sales practices and discounts.

Oracle Corporation agreed to pay the United States $98.5 million to settle allegations that PeopleSoft, which had been acquired by Oracle, made pricing disclosures to GSA that were not current, accurate and complete concerning the sale of software licenses and related maintenance services.

Oracle America Inc. agreed to pay the United States $46 million to settle claims that Sun Microsystems Inc., a corporation that merged with Oracle in 2010, submitted false claims and caused others to submit false claims to the General Services Administration and other federal agencies.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.
Source document obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request to the agency.

Description: Taleo Corp. agreed to pay the United States $6.49 million to resolve allegations that it knowingly caused false claims to be submitted to the Transportation Security Administration for a software contract.
